alert.note: Alert for Coosa; Shelby; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:10PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Talladega, southeastern Shelby and northwestern Coosa Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 410 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fayetteville, or near Wilsonville, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sylacauga, Childersburg, Wilsonville, Talladega Springs, Harpersville, Bon Air, Fayetteville, Strickland Crossroads, Marble Valley, Lay Lake, Shelby, Beeswax Creek Park, Alabama 4H Center, Shelby Shores, Cedar Creek, Highway 145 and CR 46, Kelley Branch, Varnons, Spring Creek and Gaston Steam Plant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
